tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Viktor Zuckerkandl to Heinrich Schenker, dated September 23, no year given, possibly 1912

tei:transcription.tei:p: Herr Professor Robert Click on Richard Robert. hat mir mitgeteilt daß Sie die Liebenswürdigkeit haben mich zu empfangen und daß Sie täglich um 11^h^ zu sprechen sind. It seems that this letter was written during peace, either after or, given the formality of expression that shows little acquaintance between Zuckerkandl and Schenker, rather before World War I. If NGDM2 is correct in calling Zuckerkandl “a member of the Schenker's circle of students in Vienna as early as 1912,” the letter might date from as early as that. Ich möchte daher, wenn es Ihnen recht ist, Freitag um diese Stunde bei Ihnen vorsprechen, um das Nähere mündlich abzumachen.

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Viktor Zuckerkandl to Heinrich Schenker, dated September 23, no year given, possibly 1912

tei:translation.tei:p: Professor Robert tells me that you are kindly willing to receive me, and that you can be spoken with each day at 11 a.m. Accordingly, I should like, if this is acceptable to you, to call on you on Friday at that hour, in order to settle the details in person.
